faq.question: When is the tax filing deadline in Zürich?
faq.answer: For Zürich canton, the standard deadline for filing your tax return is March 31st of the following year. However, if you file electronically or use a tax software like SwissAI Tax, you may receive an automatic extension until September 30th. faq.question: What are the tax rates in Zürich?
faq.answer: Zürich has progressive tax rates that vary by income level and municipality. The canton uses a tax multiplier system where each municipality applies its own multiplier to the base cantonal tax. SwissAI Tax automatically calculates the exact tax amount based on your municipality and income level.

faq.answer: Yes, Zürich residents can deduct work-related commuting costs. This includes public transportation expenses (GA, half-fare card, or individual tickets) and, in some cases, car expenses if public transport is not reasonable. Our AI guides you through calculating eligible deductions.

faq.answer: Each municipality in Zürich canton has different tax rates. SwissAI Tax automatically detects your municipality based on your postal code and applies the correct tax multiplier. Whether you're in Zürich city, Winterthur, Uster, or any other municipality, we ensure accurate calculations.

faq.question: What documents do I need for my Zürich tax return?
faq.answer: Common documents include your salary certificate (Lohnausweis), insurance confirmations, bank statements, mortgage interest statements (if applicable), pillar 3a contribution certificates, and receipts for deductible expenses.
